snippet: Oscar Pistorius was found guilty of a charge equivalent to manslaughter in the shooting of Reeva Steenkamp, but he was granted bail and will remain free until sentencing procedures on Oct. 13.
abstract: South African Paralympic star Oscar Pistorius is convicted of culpable homicide in shooting death of his girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp, after being pronounced not guilty of murder the day before; many South Africans find it hard to understand verdict, with some saying it is too light.

byline.original: By SARAH LYALL and ALAN COWELL
byline.contributor: Sarah Lyall reported from Pretoria, and Alan Cowell from London.

lead_paragraph: Oscar Pistorius was found guilty of a charge equivalent to manslaughter in the shooting of Reeva Steenkamp, but he was granted bail and will remain free until sentencing procedures on Oct. 13.

headline.seo: Oscar Pistorius Guilty of Culpable Homicide
headline.main: A Trial Concludes, but for South Africans, the Debate May Be Just Starting
headline.print_headline: A Trial Ends, but for South Africans, the Debate May Be Just Beginning
